definition: lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk

sentences.english: If someone has been drinking heavily and loses consciousness, get emergency help.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人喝得爛醉喪失意識，你要馬上對其施以幫助。

sentences.english: He nodded out home last night.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚回家時已爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: You can't be a basketcase, a girl who causes a scene or a girl who drinks too much.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一無是處，只知道大吵大鬧或喝得爛醉。

sentences.english: He is dead drunk. He's been drinking with his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他爛醉如泥，他剛纔一直在和朋友們喝酒。

sentences.english: Well, okay, I still get stoned.
He came home totally rat-arsed last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上他回到家的時候已完全爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: Last night I got compelety loaded and thought I drowned a fish.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我喝得爛醉，並且認爲我把一條魚扔進了水裏。

sentences.english: They staggered out of the pub, completely drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他們爛醉如泥，踉踉倉倉的走出酒館。

sentences.english: They get themselves stoned on beer.
sentences.chinese: 他們大喝啤酒，喝得爛醉。

sentences.english: Drew: Well, you could say, I feel really rotten.
sentences.chinese: 那，你還可以說，我喝得爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: Help return often drunk every night, afraid of the line every Baling Wei.
sentences.chinese: 夜夜扶歸常爛醉，不怕行逢灞陵尉。

sentences.english: He got absolutely sozzled at the Christmas party.
sentences.chinese: 他在聖誕節聚會上爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked.
sentences.chinese: 啄爛醉如泥的胡椒彼得吹笛者被選。

sentences.english: We've got horrifically, embarrassingly drunk together.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經一起喝得爛醉，喝醉到令人尷尬的程度。

sentences.english: After 20 beers steve really got blitzed (out) last night .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫昨夜喝了20杯啤酒，爛醉如泥。

sentences.english: Fatima: You're stinking drunk and this date is over. Capisce?
sentences.chinese: 你已經爛醉如泥了，約會結束了，明白嗎？

definition: the sky spins, the earth goes round (idiom); giddy with one's head spinning/fig. huge changes in the world
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
fragment/piece/(of a film) to break in the middle of viewing
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
